definition[0]: an area of water next to the land where the water is calm, so that ships are safe when they are inside it
example[0]: as they sailed into Portsmouth Harbour
definition[1]: to keep bad thoughts, fears, or hopes in your mind for a long time
example[1]: I think heâ€™s harbouring some sort of grudge against me.
example[2]: She began to harbour doubts over the wisdom of their journey.
definition[2]: to contain something, especially something hidden and dangerous
example[3]: Sinks and draining boards can harbour germs.
definition[3]: to protect and hide criminals that the police are searching for
definition[4]: an area of calm water next to the land, where boats arrive and leave
example[4]: The island has a fine modern harbour.
example[5]: Theharbour master (=someone in charge of a harbour) may request the ship owner to remove the vessel.
